conclusion: CPIC guideline: CYP2C19 poor metabolizers have significantly reduced clopidogrel activation. Alternative antiplatelet therapy recommended.
CYP2C19*2 carriers showed 32% higher rate of major adverse cardiovascular events on clopidogrel vs non-carriers.
CPIC guideline: CYP2C19*3 classified as no-function allele. Same clinical recommendations as *2.
CYP2C19*17 carriers showed significantly increased clopidogrel active metabolite levels and enhanced platelet inhibition.
CPIC guideline: *17 allele associated with ultra-rapid metabolizer phenotype. Increased bleeding risk on standard clopidogrel dose.
CPIC guideline: CYP2D6 poor metabolizers should avoid codeine due to lack of morphine formation. Alternative analgesics recommended.
CYP2D6*4 homozygotes showed virtually no morphine formation from codeine. Tramadol O-desmethylation also abolished.
CPIC guideline: CYP2C9*2 reduces warfarin dose requirements. Include in pharmacogenomic dosing algorithms with VKORC1.
CPIC guideline: CYP2C9*3 has the largest effect on warfarin dose among CYP2C9 variants. ~50% dose reduction for *3/*3.
CYP2C9*3 carriers required significantly lower warfarin maintenance doses (mean 3.4 vs 5.1 mg/day).
CYP3A4*22 carriers required significantly lower simvastatin doses to achieve equivalent LDL reduction.
CYP3A4*22 associated with 1.8x higher tacrolimus trough concentrations. Dose reduction recommended for carriers.
